poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Looking to faze his fate The singer feigns a feint, Fails of course, though maybe the tune fares on. The curvature of nothing Is just a phase, a rhetoric, Coin a phrase to plumb it: It flares, it falls in dust and ice, a comet. But even that elliptical vector frays, The sun it frames, the Dantean flames of hell - The singer flays them with the flails of grammar. It's allarmingly Mallarmean.
